title: News regarding ShopMart
story_body:
ShopMart Appoints New Regional Operations Director for Southwest Division

ShopMart Inc. (NASDAQ: SHOPM) announced today the appointment of Jennifer Martinez as Regional Operations Director for its Southwest division, effective November 1. Martinez will oversee operations across 127 stores in Arizona, New Mexico, Nevada, and Southern California.

Martinez joins ShopMart from competitor ValueMax Corp., where she served as District Manager for the Phoenix metropolitan area for the past four years. She brings over 15 years of retail management experience to the role, including previous positions at Target and Kroger.

"Jennifer's track record of operational excellence and team development makes her an ideal fit for this role," said Michael Chen, ShopMart's Senior Vice President of Store Operations. "Her experience in the Southwest market will be valuable as we continue to optimize our regional operations."

In her new position, Martinez will report directly to Chen and will be responsible for store performance metrics, staff development, and implementing corporate initiatives across the Southwest region. She replaces Robert Thompson, who retired in September after 12 years with the company.

The appointment comes as ShopMart continues its steady expansion in the Southwest, with plans to open eight new locations in the region by the end of fiscal year 2024. The company currently operates 1,847 stores nationwide.

Martinez will also participate in ShopMart's upcoming appearance at the National Retail Federation's Big Show conference in New York this January, where the company plans to showcase its latest inventory management technology and customer experience initiatives.

Additionally, ShopMart announced it will launch a new digital coupon platform in early 2024, allowing customers to clip and redeem manufacturer coupons directly through the ShopMart mobile app. The initiative is part of the company's ongoing digital transformation strategy aimed at enhancing customer convenience.

The company also revealed plans to install LED lighting retrofits in 200 stores by mid-2024, expecting to reduce energy consumption by approximately 15 percent in upgraded locations. This initiative is part of ShopMart's broader sustainability goals outlined in its 2023 Environmental, Social, and Governance report.

ShopMart shares closed at $47.82 on Tuesday, up 0.3 percent. The stock has gained 8.2 percent year-to-date, roughly in line with the S&P 500 Retail Index.
